task_summary: Detect, grasp, transport, and place the red square block onto the table in the front-right area, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator interacts with small tabletop items. The target is a red square block initially near the right-rear of the table. The robot must perceive the block, approach precisely, grasp it with moderate force, lift, move toward a free area at the front-right, lower until gentle contact with the table, release, and back off. Other distractor objects include a green bottle, cans, and two small orange figures. The plan emphasizes controlled approach, verified grasp, safe descent, and a short retreat to avoid collisions.
preconditions: Table is clear at the chosen place zone
Robot reachable workspace includes pick and place locations
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to grasp pose
Close gripper and verify grasp stability
Place on surface with neutral yaw
success_criteria: Red square stably rests on the table in front-right zone
Gripper released and robot clear of object
failure_and_recovery: If grasp unstable: reopen, re-approach, regrasp
If contact not detected: retry lower-with-contact within limits
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after retreat completes following a successful place.

frame_3.now_evidence: Object appears secured in gripper and lifted, indicating successful grasp and transition to transfer.
frame_3.predicts_next: Motion toward place zone is expected; arm orientation suggests upcoming transport.

node_specs.description: Perceive and localize the red square.
Move to pregrasp pose with alignment.
Close gripper to grasp the block.
Check that the grasp is stable.
Lift the grasped object clear of clutter.
Translate to the desired placement area.
Descend until table contact is sensed.
Place the block onto the table with neutral yaw.
Back off to clear the placed object.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion/lighting
Premature release or no contact during placing
recovery_strategy: Open gripper and retry grasp with slightly adjusted alignment
Repeat LowerUntilContact up to safe limits, then place again
assumptions: 'place_zone_right' denotes the free front-right area visible in frames 6â€“8.
The red object is a square block; frames confirm grasp then relocation.
No explicit speed/force adjectives in instruction; default mid-range values used.

expected_success_criteria: Red square rests stably on table in front-right
